Headline: Assistance Continues to Flow to Families and Businesses as Federal Aid for LA Fires Tops $2 Billion
Summary: Financial assistance for Los Angeles fire recovery surpassed $2 billion, with survivors encouraged to apply for aid before the March 31 deadline.

Headline: Evacuation Orders Reduced to Resident-Only Access
Summary: The City of Los Angeles reduced evacuation orders for the Palisades Fire area to resident-only access, allowing residents to return with proper identification and access passes.

Headline: Border 2 Fire Spreads to More Than 5,300 Acres
Summary: The Border 2 Fire expanded to over 5,300 acres, contributing to the series of wildfires affecting Southern California, with multiple fires burning across Los Angeles County.

Headline: How to Apply for FEMA $770 Payment for California Fires
Summary: FEMA announced a one-time $770 payment for residents affected by the California wildfires under its Serious Needs Assistance Program, aimed at covering essential costs for those impacted.

Headline: Aerial Assault Aims to Stem Palisades Fire's Eastward Spread
Summary: The Palisades wildfire expanded over an additional 1,000 acres, prompting aerial firefighting efforts to prevent further spread. Evacuation orders affected 153,000 residents, with 57,000 structures at risk.

Headline: President Biden Approves Major Disaster Declaration for California
Summary: President Biden approved a Major Disaster Declaration for California, enabling federal assistance for recovery efforts related to the wildfires in Los Angeles County. This declaration provides programs to assist individuals, households, businesses, and public agencies affected by the fires.

Headline: FEMA approves extension of temporary housing assistance for Maui wildfire survivors
Summary: FEMA has extended temporary housing assistance for Maui wildfire survivors by an additional year, providing continued support for those displaced by the fires.

Headline: Death toll from Maui wildfires rises to 89, making it the deadliest in the US in more than 100 years
Summary: Officials report that the death toll from the Maui wildfires has risen to 89, making it the deadliest wildfire in the United States in over a century.

Headline: President Joseph R. Biden, Jr. Approves Major Disaster Declaration for Hawaii
Summary: President Biden approved a Major Disaster Declaration for Hawaii, enabling federal assistance for recovery efforts in areas affected by the wildfires beginning on August 8, 2023.

Headline: Evacuation orders issued for parts of Lahaina due to fire flare-up
Summary: An apparent flare-up of the Lahaina fire forced the closure of Lahaina Bypass around 3:30 p.m., with evacuations occurring in the vicinities of Lahainaluna Road, Hale Mahaolu, and Lahaina Bypass.

Headline: Governor Cooper Surveys Storm Damage in Buncombe County; Resources Continue to Surge
Summary: Governor Cooper traveled to Buncombe County to survey storm damage, see relief efforts, thank volunteers, and speak with people impacted by the storm. FEMA officials resumed door-to-door operations to help people recover.

Headline: Will Asheville's Once-Booming Riverfront Art District Ever Recover from Helene?
Summary: The River Arts District in Asheville, a vital component of the local economy, suffered extensive damage due to flooding from Hurricane Helene. The destruction has raised concerns about the district's future, with local artists and business owners facing long and costly recovery efforts.

Headline: Death Toll Rises as Rescue Crews Respond to Hurricane Helene's Aftermath
Summary: Nearly 100 people were killed across Florida, Georgia, North Carolina, South Carolina, and Virginia. Many drowned after not heeding evacuation orders; others were killed in their homes and cars by falling trees and road signs.

Headline: Asheville, North Carolina, Isolated After Helene Knocks Out Power and Roads
Summary: Floodwaters pushed by the remnants of Hurricane Helene left Asheville isolated by damaged roads and a lack of power and cellphone service, part of a swath of destruction across southern Appalachia.

Headline: SJC Lifts Hurricane Milton Mandatory Evacuation Order. Storm Shelters Closing
Summary: Effective at 5 p.m. on Thursday, Oct. 10, St. Johns County lifted the mandatory evacuation order for all of ...

Headline: Mandatory Evacuation Order Issued for St. Johns County Residents Due to Hurricane Milton
Summary: St. Johns County issued a mandatory evacuation order for all residents and visitors in Evacuation Zones A, B, and F (south of State Road 206) effective at 8 a.m. on October 9, 2024, due to the imminent threat posed by Hurricane Milton. This included the entire City of St. Augustine, St. Augustine Beach, and residents living on waterfront properties or in flood-prone areas.

Headline: Mandatory Evacuation for Zones A, B, C, and All Mobile Homes
Summary: Pinellas County issued mandatory evacuation orders for all residents in evacuation zones A, B, and C, and all mobile homes, effective immediately on October 7, 2024. Residents were urged to evacuate due to life-threatening storm surge flooding and hurricane-force winds expected from Hurricane Milton.

Headline: Mandatory Evacuation Order for Residential Healthcare Facilities in Zones A, B, and C
Summary: Due to the serious threat posed by Tropical Storm Milton, a mandatory evacuation was ordered for all Residential Healthcare Facilities within Evacuation Zones A, B, and C in Pinellas County. The evacuation commenced at 1:30 p.m. on October 6, 2024, and remained in force until further notice.
